title: Battle In The Lea
opening: After a hard battle, Marth’s Altean Army- for it had grown to be called such- set foot at last in the kingdom of Aurelis. However, joining his might to that of the Aurelians would have to wait. As Marth descended into the vast green lea separating his troops from theirs, he heard a terrible sound: the galloping of enemy destriers, far away…then closer… Then far too close.

intro.speaker: Malledus
intro.line: Aurelis, at last…The enemy will have sent their forces to meet us.

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: Grust, Dolhr, Gra..We’re up against their standing armies, and we must brace ourselves for it.

intro.speaker: Malledus
intro.line: Sire, I believe it prudent that we start taking time to prepare our troops before each battle. We should select the warriors best suited for the situation and outfit them with the right weapons and items accordingly.

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: All right, that’s sound advice- I believe I’ll take it.

intro.speaker: Bentheon
intro.line: An unknown army to the south? That must be the Altean princeling and his band of lickspittles. If they think we’ll sit by and let them join forces with the Aurelians, then they have another think coming. With this ridersbane, I’ll litter the lea with their cavalry!

visit.speaker: Young Man
visit.line: Weapons can be crafted of iron, steel, or silver, each metal more powerful than the last. You’’l need to raise your weapon level accordingly, though, before you can use them.

visit.speaker: Young Man
visit.line: General Bentheon who guards the castle was carrying a ridersbane last I saw. Keep your cavaliers away, or that weapon could spell the end of ‘em.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Did you know you can use keys to unlock doors and lower bridges? …You did? Ahem! Right, of course you did.

visit.speaker: Middle-Aged Man
visit.line: There’s no terror like the dracoknight. One false move when they’re flyin’ about, and you can kiss your life goodbye.

visit.speaker: Old Woman
visit.line: Kind Altean, this kingdom is in dire need of a savior. We’ve saved up 5,000 gold and poured our prayers into every coin. Please, use this money to answer them.

recruit-visit.speaker: Merric
recruit-visit.line: Aha! Prince Marth. We meet again.

recruit-visit.speaker: Merric
recruit-visit.line: Well, yes, sire, last I looked. Whilst studying magic in Khadein, I caught wind of a war brewing and decided to seek you out.

recruit-visit.speaker: Marth
recruit-visit.line: I see… Thank you, then. I need friends like you on the battlefield. You will fight with us, of course?

recruit-visit.speaker: Merric
recruit-visit.line: Of course! ‘Twould be a passing shame if you didn’t get to see me flex a little magic muscle. Wait till I show you my latest: Excalibur!

recruit-battle.speaker: Matthis
recruit-battle.line: Lena… Where are you? What I would give to hear your voice just once before I die…

recruit-battle.speaker: Matthis
recruit-battle.line: Lena… Forgive your…fool of a brother…

recruit-talk.speaker: Matthis
recruit-talk.line: Lena?! What are you doing on a battlefield?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lena
recruit-talk.line: I was attacked by bandits in the Teeth while tending to the sick there, and these people saved me. The real question is, what are YOU doing on a battlefield- least of all this one!

recruit-talk.speaker: Matthis
recruit-talk.line: I’m not here by choice, sister of mine. Since you left, Macedon has only gotten worse and worse. They forced me to enlist- you know I hate warfare, but it was into the army or onto the chopping block.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lena
recruit-talk.line: Shame on you, Matthis. If you’re going to fight, then at least fight for something you believe in. Medon has done terrible things: marrying their might to Doluna, helping them torment people…Brother, it’s not too late. You could join Altea’s forces. They’re good people you know. Prince Marth would welcome you. They all would.

recruit-talk.speaker: Matthis
recruit-talk.line: …All right, then. If I’m gonna to die, I’d rather die as one of the dashing than one of the dastardly. You know, Lena, you always were the reliable one and now you’re all grown up…I thought for sure you’d have already settled down with your one true love.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lena
recruit-talk.line: T-true love? I’ve…I’ve met no such man, Matthis.

recruit-talk.speaker: Matthis
recruit-talk.line: Hmm, is that so? I’ll bet you haven’t… Well, you just be careful. There are plenty of thieves out there who would steal a girl’s heart.

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: You must be Matthis, Sister Lena’s-

battle-talk.speaker: Matthis
battle-talk.line: ACK! Y-you’re Prince Marth! Aieee! S-s-stay your rapier, I beg you!

battle-talk.speaker: Matthis
battle-talk.line: You mean…you haven’t come to stick me like a pig for fighting under the Macedonian standard?

battle-talk.speaker: Matthis
battle-talk.line: Oh! Uh, right then… Sorry about that little display. I guess Lena was right. Just goes to show not all princes are cut from the same cloth!

battle-talk.speaker: Matthis
battle-talk.line: Oh, well, our prince- Prince Michalis of Macedon, that is- he’s strong, and proud…and an utter tyrant. They say he put the soldiers who look the most scared in the front lines on purpose.

battle-talk.speaker: Matthis
battle-talk.line: Don’t worry, sire, I won’t mistake you for him again! Altean princes I can trust!

boss.speaker: Bentheon
boss.line: You can defy us, yes... But you will never defeat us.

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: Prince Marth, you have our thanks for liberating the south castle. You’ll find Captain Hardin protecting the king and the lady Nyna at the Northern Fortress, located in Aurelis. When you find him, please be sure to give him this silver sword.
